conclusion: Determine velocities of balls after elastic collision using conservation of momentum and kinetic energy.
Before collision: Mass of P is 4m, velocity of P is v0, mass of Q is m, velocity of Q is 0.
After collision: Velocity of P is v1, velocity of Q is v2.
Total momentum before collision equals total momentum after collision.
Substitute values into momentum equation: 4m(mg/qB) + 0 = 4m v1 + m v2.
Total kinetic energy before collision equals total kinetic energy after collision.
Substitute values into kinetic energy equation: 2m(mg/qB)^2 = 2m v1^2 + 1/2 m v2^2.
Solve system of equations: 4mg/qB = 4v1 + v2 and 4m^2g^2/q^2B^2 = 4v1^2 + v2^2.
Substitute v2 into kinetic energy equation and simplify.
Combine like terms in kinetic energy equation.
